author: Defense World Staff
title: Microbot Medical (NASDAQ:MBOT) Share Price Passes Above 200 Day Moving Average Following Weak Earnings - Defense World
text: Microbot Medical Inc. ( NASDAQ:MBOT – Get Free Report )’s share price passed above its two hundred day moving average during trading on Wednesday following a better than expected earnings announcement. The stock has a two hundred day moving average of $2.23 and traded as high as $3.12. Microbot Medical shares last traded at $3.04, with a volume of 1,722,279 shares traded. The biotechnology company reported ($0.10) earnings per share for the quarter, missing analysts’ consensus estimates of ($0.08) by ($0.02). Separately, Wall Street Zen raised Microbot Medical from a “sell” rating to a “hold” rating in a report on Saturday, June 14th. Check Out Our Latest Stock Report on MBOT A number of institutional investors have recently modified their holdings of MBOT. Renaissance Technologies LLC acquired a new position in shares of Microbot Medical during the 4th quarter worth $118,000. Geode Capital Management LLC raised its holdings in shares of Microbot Medical by 24.7% during the 2nd quarter. Geode Capital Management LLC now owns 395,039 shares of the biotechnology company’s stock worth $996,000 after buying an additional 78,121 shares in the last quarter. DNB Asset Management AS raised its holdings in shares of Microbot Medical by 67.9% during the 2nd quarter. DNB Asset Management AS now owns 192,786 shares of the biotechnology company’s stock worth $486,000 after buying an additional 77,965 shares in the last quarter. Goldman Sachs Group Inc. acquired a new position in Microbot Medical in the 1st quarter worth about $57,000. Finally, Virtu Financial LLC acquired a new position in Microbot Medical in the 1st quarter worth about $42,000. Institutional investors and hedge funds own 16.30% of the company’s stock. The business has a fifty day simple moving average of $2.61 and a 200-day simple moving average of $2.23. The firm has a market cap of $110.60 million, a price-to-earnings ratio of -5.24 and a beta of 1.15. ( Get Free Report )Microbot Medical Inc, a pre-clinical medical device company, engages in the research, design, and development of robotic endoluminal surgery devices targeting the minimally invasive surgery space. The company offers LIBERTY, an endovascular robotic surgical system which allows physicians to conduct a catheter-based procedure from outside the catheterization laboratory, and avoid radiation exposure, physical strain, and the risk of cross contamination for use in cardiovascular, peripheral, and neurovascular spaces.
